article.headline: Yale 74, Sacred Heart 64
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Dominick Martin had 19 points and 10 rebounds, and Yale held off a second-half comeback to beat Sacred Heart 74-64 Wednesday night. Yale led by 10 at halftime and expanded the lead to 19 early in the second half. But a 21-6 Sacred Heart run made it a four-point game with 9:25 to play. The Pioneers got as close as two, but a Casey Hughes tip-in started a 10-0 Yale run that put the game away. Sam Kaplan scored 17 points for the Bulldogs (2-3) and Edwin Draughan added 16 points and eight rebounds. Ryon Howard led four Sacred Heart played with 14 points. Joey Henley had 10 points and 10 rebounds. The Pioneers (1-4) shot just 35 percent, though they made 10-of-23 from 3-point range, including five during the run that got them back in the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
